title: How to Cook Mediterranean Sprouting Broccoli

steps.headline: Trim the broccoli so that it is in separate 'branches'.
Cook it for two minutes in a pan of lightly salted boiling water.
Heat 2 table spoons of oil in a griddle pan or a large, non-stick frying pan and add the broccoli.
Cook over a high heat for about 5 minutes, turning it all over about halfway through this time.
Add the cheery tomatoes (leave them whole) and the pine nuts and cook for a further 2-3 minutes.
steps.description: When the tomato's skins begin to pop and the pine nuts turn a golden colour it is done.

steps.headline: Add mozzarella slices to the top of the broccoli.
Heat for another 2-3 minutes until the cheese melts.
Take it off the heat and scatter basil over the top.
Mix 1 tablespoon of oil with some balsamic vinegar and drizzle over the top.

text: Trim the broccoli so that it is in separate 'branches'.  Cook it for two minutes in a pan of lightly salted boiling water.  Drain the broccoli well.  Heat 2 table spoons of oil in a griddle pan or a large, non-stick frying pan and add the broccoli.  Cook over a high heat for about 5 minutes, turning it all over about halfway through this time.  Add the cheery tomatoes (leave them whole) and the pine nuts and cook for a further 2-3 minutes. When the tomato's skins begin to pop and the pine nuts turn a golden colour it is done. Lower the heat.  Add mozzarella slices to the top of the broccoli. Add black olives as well. Heat for another 2-3 minutes until the cheese melts.  Take it off the heat and scatter basil over the top. Add some salt and pepper. Mix 1 tablespoon of oil with some balsamic vinegar and drizzle over the top.  Serve.
